Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: cgomezhmo
Reviews.Content: It had friendly staff and is in good location. Courtains do not shut sun completely. It is an expensive hotel. Beds are comfortable and clean. Bathroom clean. Like this. Also liked that the Air Conditioning worked very good.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Sabine V
Reviews.Content: + : friendly staff Spacious family rooms Breakfast is ok Good Location - : no in-depth cleaning of the bathroom (old dirt in corners) Lightswitches were dirty Little maintenance issues are not being taken care off High tech is outdated

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: david c
Reviews.Content: Rooms very basic, messy and the whole hotel looks like it is need in need of a good clean and re-decoration. Curtains looked like they had not been washed in ages. Breakfast a bit simple and limited on choice which can be annoying if staying for any length of time. Good point is that it is near to city centre and staff are helpful. In summary, not really worth the experience given that there are plenty of better hotels to choose from in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel, close to city centre, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: ira35
Reviews.Content: Comfortable for a family of four (double bed + bunk beds separated by a curtain), spacious bathroom, nice breakfast (fresh fruit, lots of hams 7 cheese, pastry- not very satisfied with machine coffees and drinks in general), very nice staff: polite and ready to assist. Wi-fi rooms. Excellent location, short walking distance to the city centre (Plaza Catalunya). For longer distances, just next to the hotel there is a taxi station.

Reviews.Title: “Some good, some bad”
Reviews.Author: Ben P
Reviews.Content: Pros: laptops included in rooms. Spacious. Updated bathroom. Good staff. Fair prices. Good if you want to fit 3-4 in one room. Cons: some people like this location, I happened to think it was just a tad too far from what I was interested in. Rooms were a little too simple. Beds a little too hard. Whole hotel was too dark. In general, "it works." Nothing to write home about, but it'll do, especially if you want to put three to four people in a room for the price of one.

Reviews.Title: “really great for families”
Reviews.Author: Philippa W
Reviews.Content: Just come back having had a great time. What super room - we had a quad with large bunk beds off the main room for our two kids, 16 and 9 years. The bunks were really comfortable and the room was spacious and clean. The staff were very pleasant and friendly. The internet is fast and great for downloading stuff. It is in a super location for sightseeing and near many reasonably priced restaurants. We booked through octopus - who always produce a good hotel for us. This is a genuine review stayed 14th to 17th feb 2012 in room 214 Philippa From Cardiff UK

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Torino74
Reviews.Content: I have to say that I just entered this hotel and I actually lole it. I am readin the other messges on Trip advisor which are not so positive. I guess I was lucky with the room. I will be back with the family in a few weeks. Lets hope that they treat us well.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel!”
Reviews.Author: holl314
Reviews.Content: The Petit Palace BCN is a lovely place. The room could sleep 4; two in a double bed and two drop-down murphy bunks. The bathroom was large, with a jacuzzi tub. Staff was very friendly, location great, breakfast buffet had everything. (Coffee maker was one-at-a-time espresso, so many stood at it for three cycles for a decent sized cup. A better idea would be for the staff to make it by the thermos-full, but they don't). Location could not be better, as it was right in the middle of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 star........”
Reviews.Author: kamarora
Reviews.Content: The pictures look real good on the web but when you get there you wont be so impressed. The hotel is very minimalistic which is not bad in itself but there are quite a few basics missing. No mirror in the bedroom. Basic hygiene of the rooms really poor. bedsheets not clean. Carpet stained. Breakfast very basic buffet style but then again it was only 10 euros a head per day if you eat every day you are there. The beds are uncomfortable. People are still smoking in their bedrooms even though it is banned (no 'no smoking signs' up anywhere) and you can smell the smoke coming through the vents in the rooms. The air con does not work. We were cold throughout the night. Staff are pleasant but few. Beds were uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel to explore Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Berong
Reviews.Content: If you are on a budget but do not want a crappy place, I'd recommend this hotel. Stayed at a room with a double bed and a separate part with a bunk bed. The room is clean and fresh. Toilet has a rain shower and a jacuzzi bath tub. View of the school. You can feel when the subway passes by. It is 8 minutes walk to pl de Catalunya where the airport bus stops and hop on and off bus. 3 minutes to La Ramla from pl de Catalunya. Helpful 24 hour receptionist. The bed is hard but not as bad as the beds in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “A very over rated hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mac9
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as a 4 Star property. At best it earned 2 Stars. Our initial impression of the lobby (ripped leatherette furniture) was that we had entered the wrong door, as this was a hostel, not a 4S hotel. The floor of our room had indoor/outdoor carpet with 2 large stains, the air con was not operating and was only fixed when we requested to move rooms. No restaurant, only a buffet breakfast. Really very limited facilities. It is well located, but this area of Barcelona (Eixample) has a large number of hotels. If you are booking and paying as a 4S hotel, you will not be impressed.

Reviews.Title: “A great base to explore a great city”
Reviews.Author: cappakeelontour
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 7 celebrating a 40th birthday of one of the group and we stayed here at the start of September for a weekend while exploring all Barcelona had to offer by day and night. As we arrived early one of the rooms wasn't available so we stored all our bags in the same room - wile we were doing this they organised for it to be prepared and we all could unpack before we left. We had one room for 4 and one for 3 with pull out beds, they were fine, mattresses were firm but personally I like that. The rooms had a laptop in the rooms with free internet and both had a projector in the ceiling - I suspect they can be easily converted into a small conference room if required. A big bright sower room with a great shower ... will need to be careful with all the jets that you don't soak the floor. The air conditioning worked well which was important as it was a hot weekend. The furniture in the rooms was all black and this matched the corridors - very dark and mysterious ! The red furniture in reception has seen better days. The staff were friendly and we always got a smile and were happy to help with any queries we had.

Reviews.Title: “Crap - go to the Petit Palace Museum instead!”
Reviews.Author: Shanst
Reviews.Content: On our last trip to Barcelona we stayed at Petit Palace Museum which is lovely, clean and efficient. Unfortunately when we booked this place we accidentally booked here by mistake. Way overpriced, our sink sagged because there was so much water damage, and the bathroom was generally falling apart. They advertised free bikes - but if anyone asked for them they weren't available "getting repaired". Checkout took 40 mins and I was 3rd in line. The people in front weren't difficult at all, just the process was so slow. Overall, bad value for money and not worth the hassle.

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay here! The worst service I have ever received!”
Reviews.Author: mgangels
Reviews.Content: We arrived early and they allowed us to put our bags in a storage locker. It was down hill from there. We wondered around and returned at 6 to check into our family room. 1.5hours later we finally had room keys, i'm not kidding it took 1.5 hours to check in and there were only 5 people in front of us. One of those 5 people was checkin in 3 different families. But it became clear to all of us that they were running out of rooms. We did get the family room we booked but other families around us did not get the family rooms. A number of familes were set to other hotels in the area. The next night when we came back after a day in exploring the city our room keys didn't work. I dared not go to the front of the line of 3people who had been there for quite awhile so waited 45 minutes. When finally it was clear that that the woman who was at the counter trying to check in was not going to be done anytime soon i finally begged the people in front of me to just let me ask for new room keys. The room was no where near as nice as the pictures and there was a large black patch of mold on the hight ceiling above the shower! I would never suggest that anyone stay here! The location is excellent but there are many hotels in the area! The beds were very hard i had bruised hips....and I'm not a heavy person.

Reviews.Title: “great location but that is it”
Reviews.Author: IrelandOlive
Reviews.Content: on arrival after a 3 hr delay from dub our room was given 2 someone else we had 2 kids 11 and 16 and they though that we could sleep in one double bed and they would sort it out in morn as it was one thirty at night so with a lot of chat they got us another hotel 20 mins awy so it was 3 in morn b4 we got 2 bed we came back the next day and they had 2 rooms ready 4 us they r very basic and u would expect a lot more for a 4 star breakfast is really bad but we got it 4 free over the mixup but i certainly wouldnt have liked 2 pay 4 it there was no bar in hotel beds r rock hard so if u have a bad back dont stay i was up at 7 with pain in backjust of the main ramblas st its a good location but i wouldnt return

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing - don't know where the 4 stars come from?!”
Reviews.Author: schnutzi68
Reviews.Content: First of all we've chosen this hotel because if its location, which is very centre, and also it was described that the hotel has a parking facility - WHICH WAS NOT TRUE. There was a possibility to park the car in the public parking garage nearby the hotel, with fee of €30/day. We arrived at the hotel and horrified by the screaming noise of kindergarten at the same building, just next door of the hotel, which you could hear very clear from every corner of the hotel, and of course from the room. Then we entered the room and was very dissapointed... the room was small, the furnitures were of poor quality, you could see the damage in every corners... the bathroom was not clean, the amenities were cheap (4 stars???), the surface of the sink table are dirty and pealed off... the floor mat & towels were old you would be ashamed to have it in your guest bathroom! The nightmares continued as we checked out, the staff at the receptionist told us that there was a problem in the connection for credit card payment, so we have to pay in cash! What if the guest had no cash? We asked to speak to the Hotel Manager but.. it was Sunday so the Hotel Manager was not there.... what a service!!!! There were so many things and places we would like to visit again in Barcelona, as it's indeed a very nice city, but NEVER THIS HOTEL...!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: BNich
Reviews.Content: Booked 4 nighs at this hotel. On arrival we were disappointed with the size and standard of the room.. On asking the receptionist to be moved we were told there were no larger rooms available that night but we would be moved the following day. But the next day we were told that the larger room had been given to a preferred guest. The room was like a sauna as there was no air conditioning available at that time of year, resulting in us being unable to sleep. The small window opened onto a small enclosed area so no view and no fresh air. Majority of staff at the desk were very unfriendly.

Reviews.Title: “beds too hard to make me stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: komondor
Reviews.Content: First off i would not recommend this hotel based on the hard beds! Now I used to sell mattresses for a living. The ones at this place are harder than anything I ever sold. If you want to try the feeling out go and take the mattress off your box spring and lay down on the box spring, if you have a platform bed just lay on the platform it will be close. The next major issue is an odd one the room has heat or ac depending on the time of the year. We had mild temps and did not need either with the windows (balcony door) closed the room became very stuffy at night with the door open it was very noisy. last issue is another odd one, the WIFI it was very poor and dropped very often. i spoke to the desk about the issue and they insisted they used and outside service and everything was good. In the lobby the wifi SSID was the same as our room but in the lobby a web site came up and required a username and password. Our room on the 3rd floor had no logon screen at all but very poor connectivity. There is a hardwired IBM laptop in each room and you can request a mouse if you don't like using a touchpad. I would bring my own wireless router in the future. The other issue i had was there is a glass shelf in the shower to hold the soap and your shampoo bottles. This shelf was loose and came down on the instep of my foot. if it hit lower or i was older I have no doubt it would have broken a bone in my foot. it looks like this http://www.thefurniture.com/store/images/DreamLine/shower_enclosures_columns/shcm-2648.jpg The person at the lobby that I brought the shelf too asked if I needed a doctor and i said no that was the last i heard from the hotel. The good Hotel location is great we could walk to most anywhere we wanted and mass transit is close too! breakfast buffet was 1/2 price 2 for 15 Euros. Which is a pretty good price, the buffet is your standard scrambled eggs, muffins rolls some lunch type meats sausage and fresh fruit. The coffee is a bit odd there is a coffee maker that offers Espresso, Cappuccino, and Cafe Americano. You can't get a cup of black coffee? The room itself was nice and the closet space is OK, bathroom was OK but the fan in the bathroom was not working at all so the bathroom steamed up when we took a shower. The staff was OK but their English was OK but don't ask questions too technical. We asked one person what people did when they got off work until dinner at 9PM and she was lost.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: shilps
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel! Not a lot I can say as we were only there two nights and mainly to use as a base but fabulous! Staff - great! Very friendly, helpful and knowledgable on the area. The rooms were great, the kids loved the huge shower and their bunk beds. Location was perfect too

Reviews.Title: “Most Uncomfortable Beds EVER !”
Reviews.Author: Irish007
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in early november, the location is good and thats all thats good about it. You might as well be sleeping on the floor the beds are that hard and the rooms are tiny. It was a really cold each night with a lot of street noise. Staff were not exactly friendly or willing to help. And as for being a hightech hotel our lap top was a dinosaur and barely worked. There are far nicer hotels in Barcelona at a much better price. i dont think this hotel deserves 4 stars at all really not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, outside noise - see review”
Reviews.Author: tigggeeer
Reviews.Content: Very strange looking hotel inside. All black and red with dark long corridors which have light sensors. The rooms are sufficient but I would not like to stay here with children. The ensuite is in glass housing and our bed was against this and there are bunk beds in the room. With children this would be cramped. We are just a couple in our 40's and didnt take children therefore perfect. Our room had a free laptop and free connection. Location - perfect. 5 mins from Ramblas and 15 mins to Sagrada Familia. All major bus routes and the tour bus route is 2mins walk to main street. This hotel has what appears to be a school behind it. The hotels are in a square on the resulting space at the back holds hundreds of children and I can't begin to tell you what the noise is like. In the evening there are youth clubs with football etc so still noisy then, on the negative side they start very early. The windows/doors are very good and you will be shocked when opening them! There is a small bar in this hotel but in my opinion pointless, Barcelona is a place to eat and drink out of a hotel anyway. Our advice for Barcelona - get stright on a tour bus (we paid for 2days) worth every penny. The beach is at the bottom of Las Ramblas, we walked and it only takes 20 mins ish. Beautiful beach and marina but do not buy a drink on any marina bar - £16 for 2 fanta's! Overall a good clean hotel with a good location but with children think twice.

Reviews.Title: “Very good-looking hotel, worth its 4 stars.”
Reviews.Author: heimensmit
Reviews.Content: Located near the center, about 5 minutes walking to the Rambles, and Placa de Catalunya. The rooms were very clean and tidy, and stylish furbished. Bathroom has nice bubble function. A relax place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Apple aspirations with PC execution”
Reviews.Author: KiwilineNY
Reviews.Content: This is billed as a "High Tech" hotel and has a sleek black and white decor, motion sensor lights in the hallways and even a laptop for your free use in your room! Sounds boutique-y and slick, no? But the reality is a little shabby. We arrived at 8pm on a Saturday night and stood outside for about 5 minutes as there was no one at Reception and the doors were locked. An odd start. Our room was a Family room and we were glad to see a bunk bed for the kiddies and a separate area for Mummy and Daddy. But the bathroom has this strange frosted glass door so that not only does the light bother anyone sleeping in the bunk beds, but everyone in the suite, ah, participates in whatever happens in the bathroom. Good thing we're a close family. Our particular room, while clean, had dreadful water damage on the carpet and pretty poorly applied sleek black wallpaper. Oh, and the IBM Thinkpad left for our use was battered and missing a few keys. Kind of a metaphor for the whole place. I'm only harping on all this because rack rate for this room is about 450 euros/night! I would have been livid had I paid that!

Reviews.Title: “different , i liked it”
Reviews.Author: theSHAHS
Reviews.Content: barcelona!! its such a beautiful city. the petit palace is a chain of hotels in spain. they are high tech hotels. each room has a screen and projector, fax machine printer and all sorts of gizmos.the rooms were black and purple!! large rooms on the ground floor. the whole hotel is dark and painted black like a night club and the small lobby has bright red leather sofas!! Its quite shocking but then its a good change from the usual browns beiges and chandeliers!! the receptioniss are very nice polite and helpful.... i recomend it.....location was great...there is a super bar just adjoing the hotel called gran fok...we were there everynight!! super time

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: LorLev
Reviews.Content: The hotel is modern and colorfully decorated. I generally like these things, however it looked like all the furniture was trucked in from the local IKEA. The room was sufficient and reading other reviews, I guess I should be happy that ours faced the street as opposed to the schoolyard. It was not exactly quiet, but then cities rarely are. We did not eat at the hotel (I think there is a breakfast room), though my friend did use the "fitness facilities," which were not the best. Our biggest complaint was the staff. No matter what we asked them (including "where is the gym") they either didn't know or misdirected us. We spent much of our first two days just finding better ways to get around than whatever suggestions they made. Make sure to get a map of the city from somewhere else- the one they give is ridiculous- in addition to the bad directions.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and spacious, conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: explorerHIghWycombe
Reviews.Content: We (my partner and myself and son age 11) stayed at the Petit Palace BCN. Room was spacious with double bed and pull down bunk beds and room and bathroom were cleaned thoroughly each day. Our son enjoyed the free internet access as he could play games on the PC! Location of hotel was good, within easy walking distance of Place de Catalunya and Ramblas. We did not try hotel breakfast as it seemed overpriced, there are good coffee shops for a coffee and croissant breakfast nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Take your earplugs!”
Reviews.Author: miketraci
Reviews.Content: This hotel is rated as a 4 star - well it shouldn't be - its more like a 3 star at a push and it is the noisiest hotel i have ever stayed in. The room we were allocated was overlooking the back of the hotel which had a number of playgrounds and football courts which were in perpetual use from 8am til 10 at night. We complained and were moved to another room which was also very noisy but this time from the main road that runs out the front. In addition there was a restaurant next door that had a live band which carried on until 1am, at least so the constant thud didn't make it very restful! The first room we had was a bit cramped and was hot and very stuffy. The only way to make it less stuffy was to open the window but the racket outside made that impossible. The second room was bigger and much nicer all round. Even though we went out for most of the day we were hoping for a few days rest without the kids - but first thing in the morning was not peaceful. The decor was a bit weird and too dark and also looked a bit cheap. They have tried to make the hotel quirky but it doesn't work. The bedroom is separated from the bathroom by an obscured glass partition which didn't give much privacy and could be a bit embarrassing in certain circumstances! If you don't care about the noise you might find this hotel ok but i wouldn't recommend it to anyone i know.

Reviews.Title: “building work”
Reviews.Author: cove1970
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice abit noisey though with building work in next hotel quite a bit of road noise aswell.over all not bad... No bar 6out of 10

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel!”
Reviews.Author: alisonredpath
Reviews.Content: Absolutely brilliant hotel. Brilliant location. Staff were extremely helpful! Room was cleaned daily and was immaculate. I thought the room was of adequate size and would not describe it as being pokey. I would recommend this hotel. In walking distance to las ramblas and many nice restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “This is not a 4 star plus hotel”
Reviews.Author: JMayers2308
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in a high tech room. No hotel information supplied. Rooms small and pokey and looking tired. Carpet had a big stain and a hole. Curtain hanging off the rails. Whilst room had a promised lap top no sight of the promised dvd and CD player unless you use the laptop perhaps but then only one person can watch. Also no trouser press and exercise bike as per the company´s website. Staff friendly. Overall disappointed as part of our visit to Barcelona was to have a good quality hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel for Dracula!”
Reviews.Author: Invertea
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location and friendly staff, but these are really the only positive comments I can give it. I stayed with my husband and two kids for two nights as a follow on to a med cruise. The hotel looked great and ultra modern in the photos but was a disappointment in reality. The children were actually scared of the hotel's creepy atmosphere and dark corridors. Our room was modern, but absolutely tiny and it backed onto a school playground/nursery. With all of our luggage and the children there was not room to swing a cat. The bathroom seemed to be bigger than the living and bedroom space . I lay down on the bottom of two bunk beds and bashed my head on some kind of hook protruding from the wall - very child friendly! When I considered the top bunk, I realised that there was no safety rail for my 12 year old - nothing to stop her from falling out in her sleep. I phoned reception and they sent up a porter who demonstrated that the ladder could be removed and turned sideways along the bed to create a makeshift safety rail. The lad seemed quite pleased with himself until I pointed out that she could now not get down to use the bathroom in the middle of the night, and that she would have to wake us all up to get down for any reason. After more phone calls and after being told that the hotel was full, and the absence of another ladder anywhere in the hotel, we were moved to a bigger room, which looked like a converted conference room with twin single beds and a pull down double which was very uncomfortable. The shower had jets, but if you put them on they soaked the floor - stylish but not practical. All in all a bad experience. This is not a family hotel at all, there is no atmosphere to the place and as my daughter says it is a good hotel for Dracula!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was ok, location a bit too far out for me”
Reviews.Author: Glos1983
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner went to Barcelona for his 30th. Absolutely loved the city and will definately go back. The hotel itself was very modern and clean, the hotel staff were ok never really had a lot to do with them other than checking in/out. They give you a book of barcelona with all the metro lines and places to go which helped us so much! The rooms were nicely decorated but the beds were two twins pushed together that were on wheels? Also mattresses very hard, free internet was nice but i didnt use it. The only english speaking channel with the TV is CNN but with so much to do i dont think that should be a major issue. Was disapointed with the location of the hotel had to walk a fair trek to get to the Ramblas and other attractions but if you like walking or prepared to use the metro then this hotel will be fine, we stayed in room 302 on the third floor at the front of the hotel and it was very noisy in the morning with traffic but i dont think you will escape this in barcelona. Rooms cleaned everyday, new towels, mini bar well stocked but very expensive but isnt it in every hotel? Overall pleased with my stay but when i go back i will definately book a hotel on or near the ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Cutting edge style”
Reviews.Author: Marylynn1949
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well-situated, easy walking distance from Placa Catalunya (where the airport Aerobus stops), and central for sightseeing. Charming receptionist, very modern decor (mostly black). The bedroom had a very comfortable double bed (2 single bases) and pull-down bunk beds behind a diaphanous curtain. The room was small, and one side of the bed was right up against the shower room (opaque glass) wall, but it was spotlessly clean and well designed, with plenty of storage space, a safe and a fridge. The shower was state-of-the-art with 3 different sprays including massage jets. In common with other reviewers, we found the room noisy because it was on the inside overlooking the central square which is a sports and play area, in constant daily use. However, all the players go home eventually, and don't start again until just before 08.00. The only real downside to this hotel was the breakfast. They charge 15 euros, and after the first day we just gave up on it and went to BraCafe on the next corner, for the best coffee in the world. The hot buffet was cold, they ran out of fresh fruit, and the drinks machine was broken for the entire 3 days we were there. The staff just said "tomorrow" and did not offer to bring coffee from the kitchen. The receptionist listened to our comments on day 2, but nothing had changed by day 3.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for enjoying Barcelona with a family”
Reviews.Author: NialF
Reviews.Content: The Petit Palace turned out to be a great place from which to enjoy Barcelona, located about 5mins walk from Catalunya square (and all the tourist buses) and 15min walk from Sagrada Familia. We had read a couple of mixed reviews, mainly about the noise generated by the schools that have their play areas behind the hotel, but this didn't represent a problem to us and, if anything, it give our two kids (4 and 7) something else to enjoy from the balcony of the room. The room itself was big enough and the massive double bed that we had gave us as much enjoyment as the kids got from their bunkbeds. If there was a DVD player we didnt find it. The staff were very friendly and very helpful. The main drawback was the breakfast, which is set in a dark basement floor and cost a ridiculous €50 a day for the family (adults €15 each, kids €10 each) we gave it a miss after day one and just went somewhere local for a quarter of the price. Cant understand why they charge kids €10 each when all they will eat is a bit of toast. Definitely not a 5/5, but a good solid 4.

Reviews.Title: “very dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: S_yorksTravelbug
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the petit palace, warning, this is not a 4 star hotel. upon arrival we were given room 306 which over looks the back of the building ( having requested a room at the front before hand) the back of the hotel over looks a school playground where roller hockey games take place late into the evening, you could not hear your self think and to top that off the room is tiny and hot beyond belief, we complained about the heat and were told to turn down the air con- how stupid do they think we are, the first thing we did was turn down the air con but it is set to winter and therefor blows warm air!! we were then told we could be moved the following morning to a cooler room this room turned out to be the conference room with a pull down bed that was very uncomfertable and only suitable if you are about 5 feet tall, the pillows are as flat as pancakes and there is nothing welcoming about the rooms. the internet connection did not work therefor my daughter could not watch her dvd's. the room service not is 24hrs and the mini bar in the room only had 1 bottle of water, hardley fulfils a familys needs not to dehydrate!! all in all this was a very basic hotel, the location is good but i would not reccomend this hotel for a comfertable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found !!!”
Reviews.Content: Just returned after spending 2 great nights at the petit Palace,I must say i was a little aprihensive about it after reading so many mixed reviews,however i am glad to report that this place is a hidden secret, 3 of us, 3 football supporters (ok our team lost against the mighty Barca) Grown men, fussy individuals,booked a triple room, 2 Very large Bunk Beds and a Queen /king size bed,whichever is bigger, LCD, laptop, and hydro bath,heaven!!! the hotel,was very trendy, the receptionist was excellent, and had a smile for us at all times during our stay, the Bar??? as previousley stated is a corner with about 30 empty bottles of Raspberry flavoured Absolute Vodka as a backdrop, little atmostphere but with a choice of bars just a block away, this wasn,t a problem as we didn,t want to spend our time sitting in the hotel anyway, also in the room we had a balconey, didnt hear much traffic even though it was on a main street, only 2 towels in the room for showers on arrival, asked for more at reception, and they were in the room within minutes, there was also a complmentery bottle of Jameson Irish whiskey (Baby Size) in the room and when the porter relalised there were 3 men in the room he gave us a few more, excellent,, we didnt use the breakfast facility,s as we discovered a lovely coffee shop Bracafe just minutes away from the hotel to the left, the location is very good within walking distance to Catalonia Square, Las Ramblas etc,overall we were very impressed and look forward to a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel I can remember!”
Reviews.Author: ShaddowSmile
Reviews.Content: I booked the Hotel over the internet, just going by the pictures & reviews that I had read on this site. I am so very glad that I did! The hotel itself is so lovely - modern, tasteful, excellently equipt & very clean. It's location couldn't be more perfect for the sites of Barcelona: Gaudi buildings, museums, shops, bars, resaurants, & Catalyuna Square litterally around the corner; bus & Metro services bring everything else one ride away - very few changes of bus or metro-line even. Extremely easy, which is what I need when I am on holiday... The hotel staff were beyond helpful with every request, even when we needed emergency dental treatment - the receptionist 'phoned her boss & we got to see his dentist straight away. That is impressive service, & excellent customer care. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. There are schools next door, but this effects you very little. Not an issue when the hotel is so wonderful.
